javelin.model.condition

Class Poisoned

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.condition.Condition
      • javelin.model.condition.Poisoned
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Poisoned
extends Condition
    A poisoned unit takes a certain amount of constitution damage immediately and a secondary amount after a short while.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Monster.raiseconstitution(Combatant, int), Serialized Form

      void dispel()
      This is called when a condition is removed by DispelMagic, mostly as a way to prevent negative effects from happening in Condition.end(Combatant), when applicable.

      • dispel

        public void dispel()
        Description copied from class: Condition
        This is called when a condition is removed by DispelMagic, mostly as a way to prevent negative effects from happening in Condition.end(Combatant), when applicable. See Poisoned as an example.
        Overrides:
        dispel in class Condition
